edu.cmu.sphinx.fst.operations

Class Compose

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.sphinx.fst.operations.Compose

  • public class Compose
extends java.lang.Object
    Compose operation. See: M. Mohri, "Weighted automata algorithms", Handbook of Weighted Automata. Springer, pp. 213-250, 2009.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void augment(int label, Fst fst, Semiring semiring)
      Augments the labels of an Fst in order to use it for composition avoiding multiple epsilon paths in the resulting Fst Augment can be applied to both Fst and ImmutableFst, as immutable fsts hold an additional null arc for that operation
      static Fst compose(Fst fst1, Fst fst2, Semiring semiring, boolean sorted)
      Computes the composition of two Fsts.
      static Fst get(Fst fst1, Fst fst2, Semiring semiring)
      Computes the composition of two Fsts.
      static Fst getFilter(java.lang.String[] syms, Semiring semiring)
      Get a filter to use for avoiding multiple epsilon paths in the resulting Fst See: M.

    • Method Detail

      • compose

        public static Fst compose(Fst fst1,
                          Fst fst2,
                          Semiring semiring,
                          boolean sorted)
        Computes the composition of two Fsts. Assuming no epsilon transitions. Input Fsts are not modified.
        Parameters:
        fst1 - the first Fst
        fst2 - the second Fst
        semiring - the semiring to use in the operation
        sorted - sort result
        Returns:
        the composed Fst

      • get

        public static Fst get(Fst fst1,
                      Fst fst2,
                      Semiring semiring)
        Computes the composition of two Fsts. The two Fsts are augmented in order to avoid multiple epsilon paths in the resulting Fst
        Parameters:
        fst1 - the first Fst
        fst2 - the second Fst
        semiring - the semiring to use in the operation
        Returns:
        the composed Fst

      • getFilter

        public static Fst getFilter(java.lang.String[] syms,
                            Semiring semiring)
        Get a filter to use for avoiding multiple epsilon paths in the resulting Fst See: M. Mohri, "Weighted automata algorithms", Handbook of Weighted Automata. Springer, pp. 213-250, 2009.
        Parameters:
        syms - the gilter's input/output symbols
        semiring - the semiring to use in the operation
        Returns:
        the filter

      • augment

        public static void augment(int label,
                           Fst fst,
                           Semiring semiring)
        Augments the labels of an Fst in order to use it for composition avoiding multiple epsilon paths in the resulting Fst Augment can be applied to both Fst and ImmutableFst, as immutable fsts hold an additional null arc for that operation
        Parameters:
        label - constant denoting if the augment should take place on input or output labels For value equal to 0 augment will take place for input labels For value equal to 1 augment will take place for output labels
        fst - the fst to augment
        semiring - the semiring to use in the operation
